chatgpt_double_star.new_statement: Policing should be guided by the principle that lasting safety depends on protecting constitutional rights, using the least force necessary, and treating every person with respect. Agencies should set clear, enforceable policies for stops, searches, and use of force; train and evaluate officers on de-escalation, bias mitigation, and crisis intervention; and publish timely data so the public can see what works and what needs to change. Communities should have meaningful input and independent avenues for review, while nonviolent behavioral-health and social-service calls are routed to the right responders and officers receive adequate staffing, wellness support, and fair discipline when standards are violated.

chatgpt_double_star_rankings.new_statement: Policing should treat public safety and civil rights as mutually reinforcing, guided by clear, enforceable use-of-force standards and consistent training in de-escalation, bias awareness, and disability- and crisis-response. Transparent, independent civilian oversight, body-worn cameras where appropriate, and timely public data should ensure measurable accountability and fair outcomes. Communities should invest in mental-health and social-service responses and sustained partnerships that redirect nonviolent crises to the right responders, while supporting officer staffing, wellness, and clear, fair evaluation so trust and safety grow together.

chatgpt_double_star_personas.new_statement: Policing should keep families and neighborhoods safe while firmly protecting constitutional rights, with clear, consistently enforced use-of-force standards and a strong expectation of respect for every person. Prioritize practical training in de-escalation, crisis response, and bias/disability awareness, and route appropriate mental-health and nonviolent calls to trained civilian or co-responder teams. Build trust through transparent data, body-worn cameras, and independent oversight that is fair to residents and officers alike, alongside adequate staffing, equipment, and wellness support. Ongoing community partnership and measurable results should guide continuous improvement so safety and civil liberties reinforce each other.
